title: Integration with formr (Stateless Deployment)
text: Ensure survey item (e.g., formr spreadsheet) single calculate item store result: bwd_result: calculate item capable storing long strings (JSON).

title: Integration with formr (Stateless Deployment)
text: standard snippet use inside formr R calculate block.

title: Integration with formr (Stateless Deployment)
text: Define study parameters prepare current user‚Äôs data.
code: library(bwd)  # A. BWD Settings settings <- list(N = 2000, D = 2, intercept = TRUE)  # B. Prepare Current Data # Assume 'intake' is the survey of the current user's responses current_age_std <- intake$age_std  current_gender  <- ifelse(intake$gender == 'f', 1, 0)  covariates <- c(current_age_std, current_gender)  # C. Column Mapping # These names must match the column names in your formr results table history_cols <- c("intake_age_std", "intake_gender")

title: Integration with formr (Stateless Deployment)
text: stage, covariates vector represents new participant waiting assignment:

title: Integration with formr (Stateless Deployment)
text: Retrieve data previous participants. fetch JSON result column (primary source) covariates (backup source replaying).
code: past_data <- suppressMessages(   formr_api_results(     run_name = "my_run",      items = c("bwd_result", history_cols)   ) )

title: Integration with formr (Stateless Deployment)
text: wrapper receives. Notice bwd_result contains saved state strings. Note: 3rd row missing state. wrapper automatically use values intake_age_std intake_gender ‚Äúreplay‚Äù user restore correct state.

title: Integration with formr (Stateless Deployment)
text: Pass data bwd_assign_next. function parse JSON history, replay state necessary, calculate new assignment.
code: result <- bwd::bwd_assign_next(   current_covariates = covariates,   history = past_data,   history_covariate_cols = history_cols,   bwd_settings = settings )

title: Integration with formr (Stateless Deployment)
text: need save json_result string database. contains everything (Assignment + State + Timestamp).
code: # 1. Save this string to your formr item # (This ensures the NEXT user can read the history) bwd_result <- result$json_result

title: Integration with formr (Stateless Deployment)
text: actual string gets saved database. contains assignment current user fully serialized mathematical state required next user. Notice state field stringified JSON containing imbalance vector (w_i), iteration count, current threshold (alpha).

title: Integration with formr (Stateless Deployment)
text: can use assignment immediately R script logic (e.g., skip logic, text piping).
code: if (bwd_result$assignment == 1) {   treatment_text <- "You are in the Treatment Group" } else {   treatment_text <- "You are in the Control Group" }

title: Integration with formr (Stateless Deployment)
text: download data formr later, column bwd_result containing JSON strings. extract assignments R:
code: library(jsonlite) library(dplyr)  # Assume 'results' is your downloaded dataframe results <- results %>%   rowwise() %>%   mutate(     # Extract assignment from the JSON string     assigned_group = fromJSON(bwd_result)$assignment   )

title: Integration with formr (Stateless Deployment)
text: Checkpointing: wrapper automatically creates full-state checkpoints (default: every 20 users). Cold Starts: wrapper automatically handles first user (empty history).

what: Balancing Walk Design for Online Experimentation
title: Balancing Walk Design for Online Experimentation
text: bwd R implementation Balancing Walk Design, high-performance algorithm reducing variance randomized experiments maintaining covariate balance streaming (online) setting. package provides two primary utilities: 1. Core Algorithms: faithful port original Python balancer package use simulations R-based applications. 2. formr Integration: specialized wrapper designed handle stateless randomization formr survey framework, allowing sophisticated covariate balancing web surveys.

title: Balancing Walk Design for Online Experimentation
text: package port Python package balancer. Original Method: Arbour, D., Dimmery, D., Mai, T. & Rao, . (2022). Online Balanced Experimental Design. Original Python Implementation: Drew Dimmery use package research, please cite original paper (see Citation ).

title: Balancing Walk Design for Online Experimentation
text: can install development version GitHub:

title: Balancing Walk Design for Online Experimentation
text: package designed two distinct types researchers. Please choose section fits use case.

what: Scenario A: The Simulation & Lab Researcher
title: Balancing Walk Design for Online Experimentation
text: want run simulations, test algorithm‚Äôs efficiency, use local R session ‚Äústate‚Äù (memory) preserved. package provides R6 classes mirror Python implementation: BWD, BWDRandom, MultiBWD. Multi-Arm Support: experiments two treatment groups, use MultiBWD:
code: library(bwd)  # 1. Setup the Balancer # N: Total sample size, D: Number of covariates balancer <- BWD$new(N = 1000, D = 5, intercept = TRUE)  # 2. Simulate a participant arriving # (In a real experiment, these would be the participant's actual data) x_new <- rnorm(5)   # 3. Assign Treatment (returns 0 or 1) assignment <- balancer$assign_next(x_new)  print(paste("Assigned to group:", assignment))  # 4. Check internal state (imbalance vector) print(balancer$state$w_i) # q: Target probabilities for 3 groups (e.g., 33% / 33% / 33%) multi_bal <- MultiBWD$new(N = 1000, D = 5, q = c(1/3, 1/3, 1/3)) group_id <- multi_bal$assign_next(x_new) # Returns 0, 1, or 2

title: Balancing Walk Design for Online Experimentation
text: running study formr.org. R session restarts every user (‚Äústateless‚Äù), making sequential randomization difficult system ‚Äúforgets‚Äù imbalance caused previous participants. bwd package solves using History Replay. parses database previous results, reconstructs mathematical state balancer, assigns current user, creates serialized checkpoint next user.

title: Balancing Walk Design for Online Experimentation
text: formr spreadsheet, ensure : 1. Items collecting covariates (e.g., age, gender). 2. calculate item store result (e.g., named bwd_result).

previous_headings: Usage Scenarios > Scenario B: The Survey Researcher (formr)
what: 2. The R Code (inside a formr calculate block)
title: Balancing Walk Design for Online Experimentation
text: robust? Checkpointing: package saves full mathematical state database (default: every 20 users). Replay: last 19 users didn‚Äôt save checkpoint, package re-calculates state replaying 19 events order. Self-Healing: user drops mid-survey, assignment remains history, ensuring balance still accounted . can learn Formr Integration Vignette.
code: library(bwd)  # --- 1. CONFIGURATION --- settings <- list(N = 2000, D = 2) # Map current user's answers to a numeric vector covariates_now <- c(intake$age_std, ifelse(intake$gender == 'f', 1, 0)) # Define where to find these columns in the history history_cols   <- c("intake_age_std", "intake_gender")  # --- 2. FETCH HISTORY --- # Retrieve the JSON state and covariates of all previous users past_data <- suppressMessages(   formr_api_results(     run_name = "my_run",     items = c("bwd_result", history_cols)   ) )  # --- 3. STATELESS ASSIGNMENT --- # The wrapper handles parsing, state reconstruction, and assignment result <- bwd::bwd_assign_next(   current_covariates = covariates_now,   history = past_data,   history_covariate_cols = history_cols,   bwd_settings = settings )  # --- 4. SAVE & ACT --- # Save this JSON string to the database so the NEXT user can find it bwd_result <- result$json_result   bwd_result # Use the assignment for skip logic etc. in your formr run result$assignment # This returns the assigned group!

(2025). bwd: R Implementation Balancing Walk Design. https://github.com/timseidel/bwd

what: Balancing Walk Design with Restarts ‚Äî BWD
title: Balancing Walk Design with Restarts ‚Äî BWD
text: Balancing Walk Design Restarts. step, adjusts randomization probabilities ensure imbalance tends towards zero.

title: Balancing Walk Design with Restarts ‚Äî BWD
text: q Target marginal probability treatment. intercept Whether add intercept term. delta Probability failure. N Total number points. D Dimension data. value_plus Value added imbalance treatment 1. value_minus Value added imbalance treatment 0. phi Robustness parameter. alpha Normalizing constant (threshold). w_i Current imbalance vector. iterations Current iteration count.

what: Stateless BWD Assignment with Automated History Parsing ‚Äî bwd_assign_next
title: Stateless BWD Assignment with Automated History Parsing ‚Äî bwd_assign_next
text: Handles full lifecycle BWD assignment stateless environment (like formr). parses raw history data, replays events synchronize state, assigns next treatment, formats output efficient storage (checkpointing).

title: Stateless BWD Assignment with Automated History Parsing ‚Äî bwd_assign_next
code: bwd_assign_next(   current_covariates,   history = NULL,   bwd_settings,   history_covariate_cols = NULL,   checkpoint_interval = 20 )

title: Stateless BWD Assignment with Automated History Parsing ‚Äî bwd_assign_next
text: current_covariates Numeric vector. covariates current participant. history history object. Can : data.frame (result formr_api_results). list pre-parsed history entries. bwd_settings List. Configuration balancer (e.g. list(N=1000, D=5)). history_covariate_cols Character vector. Required history data.frame. Specifies column names dataframe correspond current_covariates, exact order. checkpoint_interval Integer. often save full state (default 20). Interim entries store NULL state save bandwidth.

title: Stateless BWD Assignment with Automated History Parsing ‚Äî bwd_assign_next
text: list containing: assignment: Integer (0 1). json_result: String. optimized JSON save database. timestamp: Numeric.

title: Serialization Utilities ‚Äî serialization
text: Utilities serialize deserialize BWD objects /JSON.

title: Serialization Utilities ‚Äî serialization
Serialization Utilities ‚Äî serialization
text: obj BWD balancer object serialize. json_str JSON string representing serialized BWD object.

title: Sample Size Expended Error ‚Äî stop_sample_size_expended
text: custom error condition thrown number units assigned exceeds pre-allocated sample size N.

title: Sample Size Expended Error ‚Äî stop_sample_size_expended
